channel.title: Client
channel.description:
When I attempt to refresh / reload my webclient it loads until "Connecting to fileserver", then stops and brings up the error screen. (Sorry, an error has occured while loading server name)
<? header("Pragma: no-cache"); header("Cache: no-cache"); ?>
Added that to the top of my .php file, but it does not work.
Galkon's refractored base.
Any help?

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @mit03 mit03
item.description:
@mit03 wrote:

[code]<? header(“Pragma: no-cache”);
header(“Cache: no-cache”); ?>

SERVER NAME Webclient [/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @mit03 mit03
item.description:
@mit03 wrote:

[quote=“mit03, post:2, topic:343049”]The cache downloads fine. The client loads up perfectly and you can login, but when you refresh the webpage it does not load. Upon restarting the browser it all loads fine again, but does not load upon refreshing the page still.

As far as I can tell, this has nothing to do with my client’s cache…[/quote]

^

And yes, that’s what I’m saying.

Read full topic

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @mit03 mit03
item.description:
@mit03 wrote:

Well, my only problem with understanding this is, it loads perfectly fine. Just stops loading when / if you refresh the web page. Then works again when restarting the browser… If there was an error in anything to do with the webclient, it wouldn’t even load the first time, would it?

Read full topic

The other one is a regular 317 deob.

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @mit03 mit03
item.description:
@mit03 wrote:

I’ve gotten other webclient to work fine for the most part. It just seems I can never get Galkon’s to work correctly.

It works perfectly fine on my desktop whenever I try to load it. It only errors when used on the web.

Read full topic

item.title: Client
item.dc:creator: @mit03 mit03
item.description:
@mit03 wrote:

The cache downloads fine. The client loads up perfectly and you can login, but when you refresh the webpage it does not load. Upon restarting the browser it all loads fine again, but does not load upon refreshing the page still.

As far as I can tell, this has nothing to do with my client’s cache…
